page.title: 05Queen Mother at Wimbish
page.content: On Friday 28th June,{Her Majesty the {Queen Mother}came to Carver Barracks, Wimbish, for the Tercentenary Celebrations of the 1st Queens Dragoon Guards. She arrived in the red Royal helicopter and landed at 11a.m. It was a long wait until she came. She wore a yellow dress and hat with a green veil. She met the Guides, Cubs and Brownies but went right past the Scouts! The Queen Mother is Colonel-in-Chief of the regiment and so she inspected the Guard of Honour. She saw a tank charge with all the tanks going at 40mph. She went to the Officers Mess for lunch. I gave her some flowers. I curtsied and was so nervous I never listened to what she said and just said "yes" all the time. {Princess Anne and Captain Mark {Phillips}came to the Ball in the evening. The Queen Mother left at 5pm.
